description: There is work to move calls to conductor into the compute api.  This creates a circular dependency which must be worked around.  Ideally the conductor would not need to call into the compute api, so we should fix the three calls that occur.
title: Conductor manager imports compute api

comments.content: There is work to move calls to conductor into the compute api.  This creates a circular dependency which must be worked around.  Ideally the conductor would not need to call into the compute api, so we should fix the three calls that occur.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~alaski

comments.content:
I ran into this working on https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1177993. Initially I thought I would replace direct DB calls in compute api with conductor calls, and realized the circular dependency.

For now, I'm taking a different approach with the bug.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~melwitt

comments.content:
These are needed for now for compute nodes to call compute api methods.  We could defer the import until you instantiate the ConductorAPI class.

Once this patch in place, the compute API should only use the ComputeTaskAPI, so that should help: https://review.openstack.org/29838
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb
